Name: Central Province
Description: A group of islands in the central part of the Solomon Islands, including the main island of Guadalcanal and the capital, Honiara.

Name: Choiseul Province
Description: Known for its rich cultural heritage and forests, Choiseul is located to the west of Guadalcanal, famous for its natural beauty.

Name: Malaita Province
Description: The most populous province of the Solomon Islands, known for its strong cultural traditions and bustling markets.

Name: Makira-Ulawa Province
Description: Located in the southeastern part of the Solomon Islands, this province is known for its beautiful coral reefs and rich biodiversity.

Name: Temotu Province
Description: The easternmost province of the Solomon Islands, consisting of several islands, including the Santa Cruz Islands, with beautiful beaches and rich culture.

Name: Western Province
Description: Located on the western side of the Solomon Islands, famous for its beaches, diving spots, and natural scenery.
